Literature Review: Over the past three decades, coronaviruses (CoVs) have emerged as significant threats to human health, with notable examples including the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV) in 2003, Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) in 2012, and most recently, SARS-CoV-2, which caused the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. These viruses have not only led to substantial economic disruptions but also resulted in a significant loss of human lives. Understanding the origins, animal models, zoonotic reservoirs, and mechanisms of cross-species transmission is crucial for managing current and preventing future outbreaks.
